TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ToolBarOverflowPanel extends System.Windows.Controls.Panel

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> might not have enough space to show all of its items. When this happens, the items in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar> can be placed in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToolBarOverflowPanel>, which is specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>. For an example of how to use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ToolBarOverflowPanel> in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>, see [ToolBar Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/toolbar-styles-and-templates.md).

Docs.param: Constraint size is an upper limit. The return value should not exceed this size.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the recommended width for an overflow before items flow to the next line.
Docs.value: A double value that represents the recommended width of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you set to 100, the width of the overflow is 100, and all the items that can fit into an area of that size are in the main . If there is only one item, and it requires a size of 120, the toolbar width expands automatically from 100 to 120. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|| ## Examples The following example shows how to use the property with a .
